meanings.definition: Treat (wood) with creosote to preserve it.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter was creosoting the fence to protect it from rotting.
meanings.sent2: I learned how to creosote the wooden deck to make it last longer.
meanings.sent3: The beavers were surprised to see the humans creosoting their dam.
meanings.sent4: She creosoted her memories with laughter, preserving them for a lifetime.
meanings.sent5: The smell of creosoting filled the air, signaling the start of the preservation process.

meanings.definition: The action of treating wood with creosote.
meanings.sent1: Creosoting is essential to maintain the integrity of wooden structures.
meanings.sent2: The creosoting of the playground equipment was done annually.
meanings.sent3: The children found joy in watching the creosoting of the old barn.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to creosoting showed his commitment to wood preservation.
meanings.sent5: The creosoting of the dock was a sight to behold, ensuring its longevity.
